title: 2025 NBA Finals: How Haliburton and Indy stole Game 1
content: NBA insiders break down the Pacers comeback win over the Thunder and the biggest takeaways from Game 1 of the 2025 Finals.

title: Pacers rally to win G1 on Haliburton's late jumper
content: Tyrese Haliburton scored with 0.3 seconds left for Indiana's first and only lead of the game and the Pacers beat the Thunder 111-110 in Game 1 of the NBA Finals.

title: QB Rodgers agrees to 1-year deal with Steelers
content: QB Aaron Rodgers agreed to terms on a one-year deal with the Steelers, the team announced on Thursday night.

title: Texas Tech tops UT to stay alive, force WCWS G3
content: - NiJaree Canady scattered six hits and pitched her way out of a seventh-inning jam, and Texas Tech forced a decisive third game in the Women's College World Series with a 3-2 victory over Texas on Thursday night.

title: Silver: Owners likely to urge exploring expansion
content: NBA commissioner Adam Silver said he believes there is enough interest among league owners to begin "a more formal exploratory phase" of expansion.

title: Slumping Conforto delivers in clutch as L.A. rallies
content: Michael Conforto broke out of an 0-for-15 slump by delivering a tiebreaking, two-out RBI single in the eighth inning, and the Dodgers rallied to beat the Mets 6-5.

title: BYU signs Young to extension after first year
content: BYU coach Kevin Young has signed a new long-term contract extension with the program, the team announced on Thursday.

title: Twin sister of Alabama freshman QB Russell dies
content: Kierston Russell, the twin sister of Alabama freshman quarterback Keelon Russell, died Wednesday, according to a statement from Tuscaloosa police officials.

title: 'No sir': Ravens asst. Pagano done with being HC
content: Former Colts head coach Chuck Pagano, who ended his four-year retirement to become an assistant with the Ravens, says he has no desire to be an NFL head coach again.

title: Aaron Rodgers to the Steelers -- finally: Grading the move, and whether he's actually an upgrade
content: The Steelers finally landed Rodgers after months of anticipation. But can the move actually improve the offense? Let's grade the signing.

title: 'Us against world': Panthers gird for key road Game 2
content: Matthew Tkachuk and the Panthers are embracing an "us-against-the-world" mentality ahead of Game 2 vs. the Oilers at a raucous Rogers Place.

title: Oilers win a thriller: Grades for both teams, what to watch in Game 2
content: Edmonton strikes first in the 2025 Stanley Cup Final. Here's how it happened and what comes next Friday.

title: Ranking every WNBA team's roster core, 1-13: Which team has the best young players?
content: Let's stack every WNBA team's core by the youth of its roster, leading off with the Fever and Caitlin Clark.

title: Power Rankings: Dream ride four-game winning streak to move up in Week 3 edition
content: Las Vegas, Washington and Chicago join Atlanta as risers as the league begins Commissioner's Cup play.

title: 'The Game 1 collapse was insane': What led the Knicks to fire Tom Thibodeau
content: Despite back-to-back 50-win seasons, whispers about Tom Thibodeau's future in New York had percolated for months.

title: Is Novak Djokovic a real contender for the French Open title?
content: He defeated No. 3 Zverev in the quarterfinals -- but can Djokovic continue this level? In his way stands Sinner, and likely Alcaraz too.

title: How members of the Pasadena Run Club are finding salvation in a post-wildfire world
content: Though still reeling from the Eaton fire, a group of L.A. area runners are determined to build a worthwhile future.

title: Barcelona keep or dump: What do Yamal & Co. need to build on success?
content: Barcelona returned to the top of LaLiga under new coach Hansi Flick. What moves should they make to avoid a step back in 2025-26?

title: Tyrese Haliburton's all-white button up leads stylish arrivals to Game 1 of the NBA Finals
content: Before the Finals could tip off, stars from both teams looked to set the tone in the pre-game tunnel.

title: Pacers, Thunder is latest matchup that includes long championship drought
content: This year is the second NBA Finals in which both participants are on title droughts that exceed 40 years.

title: What it's like in the Rockies' clubhouse as they barrel toward the wrong kind of history
content: Colorado has made headlines for all the wrong reasons so far, but the Rockies aren't giving up just yet.

title: MLB Power Rankings: Are the Dodgers or Tigers No. 1 this week?
content: While baseball's powerhouses battle for the top spot, two contenders continue their fall down our list.

title: Preview: Top storylines, prospects and major leaguers for all teams
content: Breaking down the top storylines for supers and the top prospects and current major leaguers for all 16 teams.

title: 'Like John Wayne': To succeed at Western Kentucky, Tyson Helton seeks gunslingers
content: The coach knows he's going to lose players each year to power conference programs. He's finding ways to win anyway.

title: Ranking the top 64 NHL draft prospects, including projected ceilings and floors
content: There is no hockey left to be played this season for the top players available June 27-28. Here's how they stack up.

title: Buxton goes 20/20? Rockies bats rebound in a big way? Don't be surprised
content: Eric Karabell looks into the crystal ball to tell fantasy baseball managers what might come to pass in the not-too-distant future.

title: Fantasy football buzz: What will Aaron Rodgers' arrival mean for Steelers' skill players?
content: Aaron Rodgers is headed to the Steelers, but expectations of a return to fantasy greatness should be tempered.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Ten Hag to give Antony a Man United escape route at Leverkusen
content: New Bayer Leverkusen coach Erik ten Hag is ready to make a move for Manchester United forward Antony. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: 'Disgusting abomination' to 'bombshell': Trump & Musk feud spirals; timeline of the public meltdown
content: The alliance between Donald Trump and Elon Musk has publicly dissolved after a cordial farewell turned sour. Trump threatened to cut government subsidies for Musk's companies, prompting Musk to retaliate with explosive allegations, including linking Trump to the Jeffrey Epstein scandal.

title: Top RCB official, 3 event firm staffers arrested by Bengaluru cops over stampede
content: Following the deadly stampede outside Chinnaswamy Stadium that killed 11, Bengaluru police arrested four individuals, including a senior RCB official. The Karnataka government suspended five senior police officers, including the Bengaluru Police Commissioner. The incident occurred before RCB's victory parade, with allegations of criminal mismanagement against RCB, DNA Entertainment Networks, and KSCA.

title: Feud intensifies: Musk shares 1992 video; Trump seen with Jeffrey Epstein in clip
content: Elon Musk ignited a political controversy by sharing a video of Donald Trump with Jeffrey Epstein, suggesting hidden government files implicate the US president in Epstein's alleged crimes. This claim, made after Musk's departure from a White House advisory role, has fueled demands for the full release of Epstein documents.

title: 'JD Vance understood': Shashi Tharoor in US says 'India won the narrative
content: Shashi Tharoor said that US vice president JD Vance understands the impossibility of mediating between India and Pakistan, as it would imply an equivalence between a victim and a terrorist. Tharoor highlighted India's strong diplomatic outreach, noting more meetings at higher levels compared to the Pakistani delegation. He also emphasised the unity within India regarding the issue of terrorism.

title: Watch: Indian cricket team departs for England; heralds start of new era
content: The Indian cricket team has departed for England to participate in a five-match Test series, marking the beginning of a new era following the retirement of Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli from Test cricket. Shubman Gill will lead the team, which includes both seasoned players and fresh talent.

title: War twist: Ukraine used open-source software in Russia drone attack
content: ArduPilot, an open-source software initially created for hobbyist drones, has reportedly been used in a Ukrainian attack that destroyed a portion of Russia's strategic bomber fleet. The software's creators expressed surprise at its military application, as it was originally designed for peaceful purposes like search and rescue and autonomous vehicles.

title: Norway Chess | Carlsen on losing against Gukesh: 'My tournament was over'
content: Reigning World Champion Gukesh is challenging World No. 1 Magnus Carlsen at the Norway Chess tournament. Carlsen, with 15 points, is closely trailed by Gukesh at 14.5. Following a loss to Gukesh, a frustrated Carlsen expressed his disillusionment with classical chess, even hinting at quitting. Despite a win against Caruana, Carlsen admits the tournament's enjoyment diminished after the Gukesh game.

title: Trump-Musk feud: Tesla stock price crash wipes out $150 bn; investors dump company
content: Tesla share price crash: A verbal clash between Elon Musk and Donald Trump triggered a Tesla share price crash, wiping out $150 billion from its market cap. Investors, who initially favored Tesla after Trump's election, grew concerned about potential regulatory hurdles for autonomous vehicles.

title: Meghalaya honeymoon murder: 'Stop looking for a body, wife Sonam has been kidnapped'
content: The search for Sonam Raghuvanshi, missing since May 22nd during her honeymoon in Meghalaya, continues as new CCTV footage places her and her husband Raja at a Shillong hotel. Raja was later found murdered, fueling fears that Sonam may have been abducted and trafficked across the border into Bangladesh.

title: Regulatory heat: Shein under fire in EU; hit with same complaint as Flipkart, Amazon in India
content: BEUC has filed a complaint with the European Commission, alleging that Shein uses "dark patterns" to manipulate consumers into overspending. These deceptive tactics, like countdown timers and excessive notifications, are designed to drive mass consumption. The Indian government is also addressing similar concerns, urging e-commerce platforms to regulate these manipulative practices, reflecting a global crackdown on such tactics.

title: 'Drake vs Kendrick'': Internet turns Musk-Trump fallout into ‘Mean Girls’ memes
content: A public feud has erupted between Donald Trump and Elon Musk, triggered by disagreements over a government bill. Musk criticized the legislation, leading to Trump expressing disappointment and claiming he curtailed Musk's influence. The online fallout has been met with memes and comparisons to famous feuds, captivating social media users.

title: ‘Her laptop is still on office table’: Bengaluru techie dream ends in grief
content: Devi, a devoted RCB fan from Tamil Nadu working in Bengaluru, eagerly sought permission to attend the team's victory parade. Despite missing online ticket availability, she optimistically headed to the stadium. Tragically, her friends received a call from the hospital, marking the last communication and leaving them with the heartbreaking task of informing her parents.

title: 'If we had known he was going to the stadium ... ': Shivalinga just passed Class 10 board exams
content: Seventeen-year-old Shivalinga, a Class 10 board exam pass-out, lost his life in the Bengaluru stampede after detouring to the stadium to see his favourite RCB players. A responsible son from a humble family, he was seen as their future. His devastated parents now grieve their loss, saying no compensation can replace the dreams they had for him.

title: AI killing jobs: Google AI CEO Hassabis has a tip; If I were a student..
content: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis advises students to prioritize STEM subjects and embrace AI tools for future job market success. Speaking at SXSW London, he emphasized the importance of understanding mathematical and scientific fundamentals. Hassabis predicts AI will create valuable jobs for technically skilled individuals, urging students to gain hands-on experience with AI systems.

title: Diddy's ex says initial 'passionate nights' opened 'Pandora's box'
content: A former romantic partner, identified as Jane, testified against Sean "Diddy" Combs, detailing how their consensual relationship evolved into coercive voyeuristic encounters. She described drug-influenced sexual situations with escorts in hotel rooms across the country, where Combs allegedly watched and engaged in self-gratification. Jane's testimony supports allegations of sex-trafficking and racketeering, adding to earlier accusations by Casandra Ventura.

title: Musk claims Trump 's name is in 'Epstein files'; how White House responded
content: Elon Musk ignited a feud with President Trump by alleging Trump's involvement in the Epstein files, prompting demands for their release. White House dismissed Musk's claims as stemming from dissatisfaction with the "One Big Beautiful Bill." Democrats seized on the allegation, urging transparency and questioning potential administration cover-ups.

title: Will punish guilty: Siddaramaiah on Karnataka minister's role in hurried celebration
content: Following a stampede outside Chinnaswamy Stadium that resulted in 11 deaths and 75 injuries during RCB's victory parade, the Karnataka government has suspended five senior Bengaluru police officers, including the police commissioner. CM Siddaramaiah ordered the arrest of top officials from RCB, DNA, and KSCA, alleging criminal mismanagement.

title: Top stocks to buy or sell: Stock recommendations for June 6
content: Stock market recommendations:Bajaj Broking Research suggests a continued consolidation phase for benchmark indices, highlighting resilience in mid and small-cap segments. Nifty oscillates within 24,400-25,080 range, while Bank Nifty consolidates between 53,500-56,000. Idea Forge Technology and Avantel are recommended as top stock picks.

title: Harvard files legal challenge over Donald Trump’s foreign student ban
content: Harvard University is challenging President Trump's ban on foreign students through legal action, alleging it's a retaliatory move. President Garber stated the university is seeking an immediate halt to the proclamation, which circumvents a previous court order. Harvard is working to ensure international students can continue their studies.

title: TNPSC Group 1 hall ticket 2025 for prelims: Check direct link to download admit card
content: The Tamil Nadu Public Service Commission (TNPSC) has released hall tickets for the Combined Civil Services Group 1A preliminary examination, scheduled for June 15, 2025. Registered candidates can download their admit cards from the official website, tnpsc.gov.in, using their login credentials. The hall ticket is a mandatory document for entry to the examination center.

title: Trump-Musk feud: Have all Epstein files been released? What we know so far
content: Elon Musk's claim that Donald Trump is named in the Epstein files has reignited public interest in the long-secret documents. The released files include pilot logs, Epstein's "black book," and an evidence list detailing items seized from his properties, such as recording devices and disturbing photos.

title: 30+ Best Eid Mubarak messages to share with family & friends on Eid-ul-Adha 2025
content: Eid-ul-Adha 2025 is approaching, a time for families and communities to unite in celebration of sacrifice, compassion, and faith. Sending heartfelt wishes and messages strengthens bonds and spreads the spirit of the occasion. This collection of Eid Mubarak greetings offers ways to express love and blessings to family and friends, fostering joy and togetherness during this significant Islamic festival.

title: 50k CRPF troops, drones, bomb squads & canine teams to guard Amarnath yatris
content: In response to a recent terrorist attack, the Amarnath Yatra will see unprecedented security measures, including nearly 50,000 CRPF personnel, surveillance drones, and bomb disposal squads. The 38-day pilgrimage will have heightened protection with road opening duties, quick action teams, and convoy escorts equipped with satellite phones and jammers.

title: Dassault ties up with Tata to make Rafale fuselage in Hyderabad
content: Dassault Aviation has partnered with Tata Advanced Systems Limited (TASL) to manufacture Rafale fighter fuselages in Hyderabad, as part of India's ₹63,887 crore deal to acquire 26 Rafale-M jets. This collaboration marks the first time Rafale fuselages will be produced outside France.

title: Should LA Lakers trade Doncic for $293.4 million Milwaukee Bucks star?
content: The Los Angeles Lakers, having acquired Luka Doncic, are now facing speculation about a potential trade for Giannis Antetokounmpo. While some fans entertain the idea, analysts question the wisdom of trading the younger Doncic, emphasizing his long-term potential and Giannis's injury concerns. Ultimately, the Lakers' limited assets make a deal unlikely unless Giannis forces a trade.

title: Trump-Musk feud turns ugly; escalated on social media: Top developments
content: A public feud has erupted between Donald Trump and Elon Musk over disagreements regarding Trump's economic bill and its clean energy incentive cuts. Trump expressed disappointment in Musk's criticism, while Musk claimed his support was crucial for Trump's 2024 election victory. The spat escalated with Trump threatening contract cancellations, prompting Musk to announce the decommissioning of SpaceX's Dragon spacecraft.

title: Central portal for waqf properties to be launched today
content: Minority Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju defends the upcoming 'UMEED' Central Portal for waqf properties, asserting its legality and alignment with the Constitution. He dismisses concerns raised by the All India Muslim Personal Law Board, emphasizing the portal's role in enhancing waqf management through accountability and transparency.

title: Bank holiday for Eid al-Adha: Are banks and stock market open or closed on June 6 & 7?
content: Eid al-Adha is anticipated to be celebrated in India on June 7, potentially marking a public holiday with closures for schools, colleges, and government offices. Banks will observe closures on June 6 in Thiruvananthapuram and Kochi, with varied operations on June 7 across different cities. Stock markets (NSE & BSE) will remain open, while digital banking services will continue uninterrupted.

title: NHL Trade Rumors: Maple Leafs eye risky, strategic trade for Predators’ Marchessault..
content: The Toronto Maple Leafs, facing another early playoff exit and the potential departure of Mitch Marner, are reportedly considering acquiring Nashville Predators veteran Jonathan Marchessault. Marchessault, known for his playoff success and scoring ability, could provide a short-term offensive boost. However, his recent dip in production and Toronto's limited assets could complicate a potential trade.

title: Census to pave way for nationwide delimitation
content: India's 'Census 2027', starting April 1, 2026, will enable nationwide delimitation of constituencies, being the first census post-2026. However, completing delimitation before the 2029 election seems unlikely due to potential delays in publishing final population data. The home ministry cited Covid-related disruptions to primary education as the reason for postponing the census, originally due five years ago.

title: Shehbaz wants Trump to arrange talks with India
content: Pakistani PM Shehbaz Sharif has requested the US to mediate a comprehensive dialogue between India and Pakistan, praising Donald Trump's role in de-escalating a recent military clash. Bilawal Bhutto Zardari echoed this sentiment, suggesting US mediation could facilitate broader talks. However, India views this appeal with suspicion, perceiving it as an attempt to divert attention from cross-border terrorism.

title: 'Thug Life' Box Office Collection: Kamal Haasan starrer collects Rs 17 crore
content: Kamal Haasan and Mani Ratnam's 'Thug Life' released yesterday, garnering mixed reviews and a moderate box office opening of approximately Rs 17 crore in India. The film saw strong occupancy in Tamil Nadu, but struggled in Hindi-speaking regions. This gangster action drama, set in 1994, revolves around crime, betrayal, and power struggles, featuring an ensemble cast.

title: SC: Cop pulling in-laws into cruelty case unfortunate
content: The Supreme Court, concerned about the misuse of Section 498A IPC, has dismissed a 23-year-old dowry harassment case filed by a Delhi Police sub-inspector against her husband, also a policeman, and his family. The court highlighted the growing trend of misusing legal provisions to implicate relatives in matrimonial disputes, emphasizing the lack of specific evidence to support the cruelty allegations.

title: Congress continues its attack but Khurshid, Tharoor unfazed
content: Salman Khurshid defended his participation in the government's global outreach against terrorism, despite criticism from within the Congress party. He highlighted the delegation's success in countering Pakistan's narrative and securing support for India, citing a positive response from Malaysia. Other Congress leaders like Tharoor and Tewari also supported the initiative, emphasizing its importance for national interest.

title: Skin cancer or something else? 5 signs no one should ignore
content: Be alert to subtle skin changes, as seemingly harmless spots or patches could indicate skin cancer. Skin changes are part of life—scratches, bites, and pimples come and go. But when something doesn’t look or feel right for a long time, it’s okay to ask questions. It’s okay to be cautious.

title: Stalled monsoon may revive after June 12, says IMD
content: India Meteorological Department (IMD) anticipates a potential revival of the southwest monsoon between June 12 and 18, following a stall since May 29. While uncertainties exist regarding a system formation over the Bay of Bengal, the extended-range forecast indicates robust rainfall across central India, parts of Maharashtra, and south peninsular India post-revival.

title: 60% of health sub-centres can't deal with basic issues: Survey
content: A recent survey reveals that only 40% of India's sub-centres, crucial for rural healthcare, are equipped to manage hypertension and diabetes. Many lack essential medicines like metformin and amlodipine, with stock-outs lasting up to seven months.

title: Punish Pakistan for exporting terror, Kharge urges world leaders
content: Mallikarjun Kharge has called on the world to support India, a victim of terror, against Pakistan, which he identifies as a perpetrator. He argued that financial aid to Pakistan from international institutions would only bolster its military and be used against India. Kharge also criticized Pakistan's appointment to key UN counter-terrorism roles, urging its re-inclusion on the FATF grey list.

title: In talks with EAM Jaishankar, Central Asia counterparts slam terrorism
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar, emphasizing India's zero-tolerance stance on terrorism, engaged in bilateral talks with Central Asian foreign ministers, advocating for a united front against terrorism in the region. Discussions also centered on enhancing trade, investment, and connectivity between India and Central Asia, aiming to unlock the region's economic potential amidst global uncertainties.

title: Ashwani Lohani to be director of PM Museum & Library
content: Ashwani Lohani, a railway engineer renowned for restoring the Fairy Queen and known as a "turnaround specialist," has been appointed as the director of the Prime Ministers Museum and Library (PMML). With a distinguished career heading Railway Board, Air India, and Madhya Pradesh Tourism, Lohani's three-year contract aims to transform the PMML, leveraging his expertise in revitalizing organizations.

title: 7 Covid deaths for 2nd day; Delhi sees 2 casualties
content: India reported seven Covid deaths for the second consecutive day, with Maharashtra recording the highest number. Delhi and Karnataka also reported fatalities, primarily among individuals with pre-existing conditions. The country's Covid death toll this year has reached 51, with Kerala, Delhi, and Maharashtra being the worst-affected regions. The surge is suspected to be fueled by new sub-variants.

title: Man died playing with gun in 2010, finds SC, acquits friend
content: A tragic accident led to a decade-long legal battle for Vaibhav, wrongly convicted of murdering his friend Mangesh. The Supreme Court overturned the conviction, highlighting the bullet's trajectory, which suggested a possible accidental or suicidal shooting. Vaibhav's initial panic and subsequent actions of concealing the death were considered, but the scientific evidence ultimately proved crucial in his acquittal.

title: Lunar setback: Japanese lander loses contact during descent
content: A Japanese private lunar lander, Resilience, faced communication loss during its moon landing attempt. Ispace confirmed the lander departed lunar orbit. Contact was lost during the descent. This follows a previous failed mission. The lander carried a rover and a miniature house. Other private firms are also planning lunar missions.

title: Bengaluru stampede: Top RCB official and 3 from event management company arrested
content: The arrests came hours after Chief Minister Siddaramaiah announced at a press conference the suspension of city police commissioner B. Dayananda and directed police to arrest RCB and the KSCA for the stampede.

title: Hindi speakers’ society takes the lead to celebrate centenary of Ritwik Ghatak
content: On June 8, Paschim Banga Hindi Bhashi Samaj (West Bengal Hindi Speakers’ Society), will hold a screening of Ghatak’s film Subarnarekha

title: Judge, jury and torturer: A flagrant case of police highhandedness in A.P.’s Tenali
content: The recent incident of two police personnel beating up three youth in Guntur’s Tenali in public to ‘teach them a lesson’ for allegedly attacking a constable in Andhra underscores the need to establish robust mechanisms of accountability to ensure all individuals in conflict with the law are treated justly and with dignity, writes P. Sujatha Varma

title: Andhra Pradesh reports 19 new COVID cases in a day
content: This is the biggest 24-hour jump in the State since the first case was reported from Visakhapatnam on May 20; active caseload now stands at 50

title: A museum in search of a forever home in Telangana
content: A rare private collection of tribal instruments and totemic relics gathered from across Telangana over five decades by ethnographer Jayadheer Tirumala Rao have long searched for a permanent address. When Osmania University, Hyderabad, finally offered space, student protests stopped the move. Now, caught between legacy and land politics, the museum’s future hangs in the balance. Serish Nanisetti traces the journey

title: 3-year-old girl sleeping under metro station in Uttar Pradesh raped, in critical condition
content: The accused took the girl away while her parents were sleeping and raped her at a secluded place, police said

title: Malnad farmers, planters struggle to weather the storm
content: From droughts to early monsoons to heavier-than-usual pre- and post-monsoon rains, vagaries of the weather in Karnataka’s high rainfall regions are altering farming timelines and yields, find K.C. Deepika and Sathish G.T.

title: J&K: Security forces conduct inspections in Ramban ahead of PM Modi's visit to Katra
content: Security personnel conducted sweeping inspections, including dog squad deployments and comprehensive vehicle checks. Security was also heightened at the Udhampur Railway Station

title: KTR helps bring body of BRS worker who died in Saudi Arabia
content: Babya, a BRS worker and farmer, had left for Saudi Arabia a year ago for a job. He succumbed to a heart attack on May 27

title: India's multi-party delegation holds 'comprehensive' discussions with U.S. Vice-President Vance
content: The conversation focused on strengthening the India-U.S. partnership, including cooperation in counter-terrorism domain, says the Indian Embassy in the U.S in a post on X

title: Karnataka launches district officers’ upskilling initiative with Infosys partnership
content: Sharan Prakash Patil, Minister for Medical Education, Skill Development, Entrepreneurship & Livelihood, inaugurated the programme through videoconferencing from the Vikasa Soudha

title: YSRCP demands probe into ‘irregularities’ in SSC exam evaluation
content: The YSRCP student wing criticised the government, holding Mr. Lokesh directly responsible for gross mismanagement in the evaluation of answer scripts.

title: Foreshore Estate signal, a daily choke point for beachside commuters
content: The situation at the signal has worsened in recent months due to the ongoing Chennai Metro rail construction, which has narrowed lanes and pushed more vehicles into an already tight space

title: Monsoon: Gear up to tackle any eventuality, says Chief Secretary
content: Mr. Vijayanand said in the event of cyclones, heavy rains and floods, efforts should be made to minimise the loss of property and lives, and establish normal conditions promptly

title: Citing ‘unjust racial discrimination’, Trump grants asylum to White Afrikaners
content: The decision to grant asylum to white Afrikaners comes on the heels of the Trump administration halting other refugee admissions from war-torn countries such as DR Congo, Myanmar, Afghanistan, and Palestine

title: A.P. govt. sets target to increase green cover to 50% by 2047
content: CM Naidu and Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan launch one-crore tree plantation drive; plans afoot to plant 5.58 crore saplings by the World Environment Day next year

title: Supriya Sule could not sign letter for special Parliament sessions, urges Congress to wait
content: Supriya Sule has urged the opposition leaders to wait with their demands of special session of Parliament to discuss Pahalgam terror attack and Operation Sindoor until the multi-party delegations return from various countries

title: NHRC notice to Madhya Pradesh over assault of two journalists by police
content: The journalists were manhandled, allegedly, under the supervision of the District Superintendent of Police, on May 1, 2025

title: Mumbai-Nagpur expressway now operational, cuts travel time by 10 hours
content: The road will open up new avenues since 24 districts of Maharashtra have now been connected with JNPT port and will soon be connected to Vadhavan port

title: On a wing and a prayer
content: The CSIR-National Aerospace Laboratories has, for nearly three decades, worked on perfecting the two-seater Hansa aircraft for commercial manufacture. This year, it has inked a deal with a private company that will manufacture the planes. Jacob Koshy explores why despite having research capabilities, India is still struggling to manufacture training aircraft

title: Security forces launch operation along India-Myanmar border in Arunachal Pradesh
content: “While moving through the thick forest, the patrol observed the movement of unknown individuals. In response, the patrol drew heavy and indiscriminate fire from heavy-calibre weapons, which was effectively retaliated by the security forces,” according to the Defence Ministry.

title: Ram Temple moves towards completion, idol of ‘Raja Ram’ consecrated
content: While Prime Minister Narendra Modi, the top government brass and a host of celebrities were present at the consecration of Ram Lalla, the child god, on January 22, 2024, the event this time was quieter

title: Stalin hands over appointment orders to 1,304 forest staff
content: An event to celebrate World Environment Day was organised by the Departments of Environment, Climate Change, and Forests

title: Railways to undertake random verification of Aadhaar to check for illegal immigrants
content: Railway Board has said instances of individuals staying unauthorisedly in India with fake or forged Aadhaar cards and using them as proof of identity for various purposes, including employment and travel, have come to notice

title: Police officers told not to post photos in uniform on social media
content: Move after some officers attended private functions in uniform and even shared sensitive information

title: State to rollout Coco policy soon
content: CM Naidu reviews crop procurement plans; pushes for maintaining global standards in cocoa, mango, and tobacco farming

title: Odds, post positions for the Belmont Stakes
content: Preakness winner Journalism and Kentucky Derby winner Sovereignty have the best odds in the eight-horse field for Saturday's Belmont Stakes.

title: People’s convention demands conservation of KAU’s model jackfruit farm
content: Participants tie ribbons to each jackfruit tree, embrace them, and form human chain of protection, followed by an environmental pledge to preserve the farm

title: Tamil translation of Madhav Gadgil’s autobiography A Walk Up the Hill launched
content: Prof. Gadgil recalled his long association with Tamil Nadu that began in 1973 when he started work in the Nilgiris and subsequently in Mudumalai Tiger Reserve

title: Vembanad’s clam sector plumbs new depths
content: The Vembanad Lake ecosystem and clam fishery are facing an unprecedented crisis. The deteriorating water quality and plummeting clam production have hit the lives of a large number of people who once survived on clam fishery. Hiran Unnikrishnan and Sam Paul A. find out what is worrying the ecologists as well as fishers of the region

title: Maturity shown by political parties amid Indo-Pak tension should continue to ensure nation’s security, growth: RSS chief
content: Terming conversion as “violence”, RSS Chief says that the Sangh never supports change of religion done out of force or greed, adding that those who want to “come back” must be respected

title: Commissioner failed to reject permission for revelry in writing: Karnataka government
content: The office of Police Commissioner failed to give a written reply to the RCB organisers about rejecting the permission on the grounds of lack of time to prepare for such a huge event, said the suspension order of the Commissioner of Police and four other officers

title: Seemanth Kumar Singh is new Bengaluru city police chief
content: Mr. Singh, presently posted as Additional Director-General of Police, Bengaluru Metropolitan Task Force, will replace B. Dayananda

title: Bengaluru stampede: ‘Everything that could go wrong, went wrong’
content: According to police sources, a perfect storm of circumstances converged to trigger one of the most tragic incidents in the nation’s cricketing history—the Bengaluru stampede

title: Minister of State L. Murugan meets Vietnamese delegation
content: India and Vietnam strengthen media and entertainment cooperation, highlighting deep civilisational connections and strong bilateral relations

title: Girl from tribal community in Kalvarayan Hills earns her seat in IIT
content: A. Rajeshwari,  a student of the Government Tribal Residential Higher Secondary School in Karumandurai, has ranked 417 in the Scheduled Tribe category in JEE (Advanced) 2025

title: MSME parks set to industrialise Andhra Pradesh big time, says Minister Kondapalli Srinivas
content: The government is striving to attract entrepreneurs to invest in the State by offering them tailor-made incentives and extending the required support, and the efforts are paying off, he says

title: Diplomacy is about ‘incrementalism’, says Congress leader Manish Tewari
content: Countering the Opposition party’s criticism of multi-party delegations to global capitals, delegates, including from the Congress, said they had had fruitful meetings with a cross-section of groups

title: M.K. Alagiri’s supporters seek re-entry into DMK
content: DMK president and Chief Minister M.K. Stalin recently visiting his elder brother’s house when he was visiting Madurai in connection with the party’s general council meeting

title: Trinamool leader Anubrata Mondal appears before police; NCW seeks report on ‘abusive’ audio
content: In the viral audio, Anubrata Mondal is heard making derogatory remarks at a police officer’s wife and mother; despite an FIR registered against Mondal, he has not been arrested

title: Pakistan likes to dangle nuclear bogey to get the world excited, Tharoor says in Washington
content: Congress MP dismisses questions on approaching nuclear threshold during recent India-Pakistan conflict

title: More ‘resources and efforts’ required to nurture India-Central Asia links: S. Jaishankar
content: External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar highlights the need for intensifying trade through the port of Chabahar in Iran; he further expresses support for ‘mutual settlement of trade’ in national currencies

title: As Lavrov plans India visit, Putin aide ruffles feathers by repeating Trump claim on mediation
content: Mr. Lavrov would be first FM from a UNSC permanent member nation to visit India since Operation Sindoor; expected to discuss strategic ties and the India-Eurasia FTA, which has been in negotiations since 2015

title: Maharashtra government cancels approvals for 903 projects
content: Schemes that are not operational due to land acquisition issues, local opposition, or lack of cooperation from contractors will be cancelled to prevent misallocation of funds

title: ‘Malai koothu’ has evolved, but there’s not much in the art form for ‘koothadi’
content: ‘Malai koothu’, a form of ‘therukoothu’, is culturally moored in the lives of the Malaiyali tribes of Dharmapuri and the Javadhu and Yelagiri Hills in Tirupathur. But the artists have to strike a balance between the pleasure of pursuit of an art form that caters to an already poor audience and making a living through other jobs

title: A pillar and a peak that are held most sacred by the Irula tribe
content: Members of this community celebrate the harvest from their millet land in May and June. They perform pujas for five weeks praying to the deity for another good harvest. More recently, the festival has become popular among non-adivasi members too

title: From prison to printing press: legacy of Kudiarasu, first journal Periyar published
content: In the early 1920s, Periyar, a prominent member of the Indian National Congress, was jailed in Coimbatore for leading a protest. There, he envisioned a publication that would speak “unflinching truths to power”. The result was a weekly that became not only a mouthpiece of the Self-Respect Movement but also a platform for challenging social evils

title: Delimitation will address concerns of southern States: Union Home Ministry
content: After Tamil Nadu CM questions timing of Census, MHA attributes delays to the impact of COVID-19, including the disruption to education, as most Census enumerators are government school teachers

title: Old careers continue to remain relevant, say experts
content: At a webinar on ‘Emerging Careers 2030: Why Humanities and Sciences Hold the Key’, speakers stress importance of acquiring inter-disciplinary skills

title: State Highways to construct new bridge across Then Pennar river in Tiruvannamalai
content: Proposal for the new bridge has been sent to the State government for financial clearance as technical study for the project has been completed. The project will be announced by the State government in the coming weeks before tenders were floated for the new bridge

title: PM Modi to inaugurate Kashmir’s first all-weather rail link with Delhi via Katra
content: Vande Bharat service to Srinagar to begin June 7; Chenab and Anji Khad bridges hailed as engineering marvels; ₹46,000 crore worth projects to be launched

title: Vote splitters set to play spoilsport as LDF, UDF clash in Nilambur byelection
content: The contest between UDF’s Aryadan Shoukath and LDF’s M. Swaraj has garnered special attention due to the presence of three other key players: All India Trinamool Congress (TMC) State convener P.V. Anvar, who is contesting as and Independent; BJP’s Mohan George; and Social Democratic Party of India’s (SDPI) Sadik Naduthodi. These candidates can potentially siphon off crucial votes,  impacting the outcome in a closely contested election.

title: Lalu Prasad wants to see his son who failed Class 9 become King of Bihar: Prashant Kishor
content: He made the remark while addressing a public rally in Siwan district; the former political strategist has been touring the State for his Bihar Badalv yatra; after his party garnered 10% votes in the bye-elections last year, Kishor has been trying to position himself as the third political alternative in Bihar

title: Top RCB Official Among 4 Arrested By Bengaluru Cops Over Deadly Stampede
content: The Bengaluru police have made four arrests over the stampede that claimed 11 lives during the RCB victory celebration at the M Chinnaswamy stadium on Wednesday.

title: Tesla Shares Lose $150 Billion Market Value As Trump-Musk Bromance Sours
content: Asian shares were subdued on Friday as investors hunkered down for the all-important payrolls report, while Tesla suffered huge losses on the very public feud between President Donald Trump and billionaire Elon Musk.

title: Trump Likens Russia-Ukraine War To Kids Brawl, Says 'Let Them Fight'
content: In an Oval Office meeting with German Chancellor Friedrich Merz, Trump likened the Russia-Ukraine war to a fight between children who hate each other. He also said that he communicated the same to Putin in the call.

title: Elon Musk's Big "Dragon" Warning After Trump Threat, Then A U-Turn
content: Billionaire Elon Musk, who has been publicly feuding with US President Donald Trump, on Friday announced the immediate "decommissioning" of SpaceX's Dragon spacecraft that is used by the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA).

title: Travelling Through Tunnels: The Udhampur-Srinagar-Baramulla Rail Link
content: Of the 272 km long Udhampur-Srinagar-Baramulla rail route, about 119 km journey passes through 36 tunnels, including T-50, India's longest railway tunnel.

title: Caught On Camera, Stray Bull Lifts, Drags And Tramples Man in Delhi
content: A stray bull attacked a man standing by the roadside in Delhi's Chattarpur area, and the horrific incident was caught on CCTV footage.

title: US Imposes Sanctions On 4 World Court Judges Over Israeli PM's Arrest Warrant
content: The United States on Thursday imposed sanctions on four judges at the International Criminal Court including over an arrest warrant for Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, ramping up pressure on The Hague-based court of last resort.

title: North Korea's Warship Launched After Botched First Attempt
content: North Korea has launched a warship that was damaged in May upon its attempted first launch, state media KCNA reported on Friday.

title: US Jury Convicts Pak Man Of Smuggling Iranian Arms To Yemen's Houthis
content: A Pakistani man seized last year in a raid by US Navy SEALS was convicted Thursday of smuggling Iranian weapons to Yemen's Huthi rebels.

title: Elon Musk Wants Donald Trump Impeached, Says "Trump's In The Epstein Files"
content: Elon Musk has publicly agreed that US President Donald Trump "should be impeached" and Vice President JD Vance should replace him. In a dramatic turn of events, Musk and Trump have turned on each other, in a bitter and ugly public feud.

title: SpaceX Will Decommission Dragon Spacecraft: Musk Amid Feud With Trump
content: Elon Musk's rocket company SpaceX will begin decommissioning its Dragon spacecraft immediately, the billionaire said on Thursday in response to U.S. President Donald Trump's statement that the government should cancel Musk's federal contracts.

title: Japan's Ispace Loses Communication With Moon Lander After Touchdown Attempt
content: Japanese company ispace said it has not been able to establish communication with its uncrewed moon lander Resilience after its lunar touchdown attempt on Friday.

title: 3-Year-Old Girl Sleeping Under Metro Station In UP Raped: Cops
content: A three year old girl was allegedly raped and is said to be in a critical condition, police here said on Thursday.

title: Musk Fires Back After Trump's "Disappointed" Remark, Slams "Ingratitude"
content: 'Very disappointed, don't know if we will have a good relationship anymore': Trump after Musk criticises bill

title: "Easiest Way To Save Money": Trump Threatens To Cut Musk's Contracts
content: US President Donald Trump threatened to cut Elon Musk's government contracts as their fractured alliance rapidly escalated into a public feud Thursday.

title: Man Dragged For Several Km After Car Rams Couple In Bihar
content: A 60-year-old man and his wife who were sitting by the roadside were killed after a car hit them in Bihar's Saharsa district, police said on Thursday.

title: Passport Damaged In Probe Agency ED Fire, Maharashtra Minister Allowed To Extend Foreign Trip
content: A special court has allowed Maharashtra minister Chhagan Bhujbal and his son Pankaj to extend their international travel, considering that their passports got damaged due to a fire at the Enforcement Directorate's Mumbai office in April.

title: Bharat Mata Portrait At Kerala Raj Bhavan Sparks Row, Minister Skips Event
content: Kerala Governor Rajendra Vishwanath Arlekar on Thursday said there would be no compromise on the presence of Bharat Mata's portrait at the Raj Bhavan.

title: "That Shouldn't Be Allowed": Shashi Tharoor's Quip After Son Asks Question In US
content: Shashi Tharoor made it clear at the outset that the person questioning him at the press conference is his son, Ishan Tharoor, adding with a big smile that "it shouldn't be allowed".

title: "Go Electric, Go Now" Message From G20 Sherpa Amitabh Kant To Tackle Delhi Pollution
content: Delhi becomes unlivable for three months a year, noted G20 Sherpa Amitabh Kant, underlining the severe economic and health burden of air pollution.

title: Thunder vs. Pacers: Who has the NBA Finals edge according to NBA 2K25?

title: Steelers built for prime Rodgers, but instead get older QB with questionable skills
content: the Pittsburgh Steelers ' refrain of the spring was that they were going to conduct their offseason business independent of Rodgers' decision . the Steelers bypassed nearly every quarterback option before drafting Will Howard in the sixth round . they also opted to sign Mason Rudolph as their lone true veteran quarterback .

title: 💬 Social reaction to wild NBA Finals Game 1
content: the Pacers beat the Oklahoma City Thunder 111-110 in the fourth quarter of game 1 of the NBA Finals . a Tyrese Haliburton jumper put them ahead with 0.3 seconds remaining . that is the latest game-winner in a finals game since Michael Jordan in 1997 .

title: New season, new division challengers: Ranking the NFL’s most likely worst-to-first teams
content: 25 teams have gone from worst to first in their division in a single season . the Texans are a recent example . there are clear indicators that help guide us as to which teams are most likely to go from best to first .

title: UFC 316 expert picks, best bets: How can O'Malley take back Dvalishvili's title?
content: Sean O'Malley takes on titleholder merab Dvalishvili at uFC 316 on saturday (10 p.m. ET on ESPN PPV) this is O'malley's first fight since the loss . Julianna Pea puts her women's bantamweight title on the line .

title: Why Vasiliy Lomachenko was different from the rest
content: vasiliy Lomachenko announced his retirement from boxing on friday at age 37 . he leaves the sport as a three-division world champion with a professional record of 18-3 (12 KOs) a new wave of fans will look at his record and ask how a fighter with three losses in only 21 fights can be considered great .

title: Twins turn to David Festa in wake of Pablo Lopez injury
content: our fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around baseball . a couple of the 13 games may see a sprinkle or two, but they are all supposed to play without a hitch .

title: Why are there so few women coaches in professional tennis?
content: her career came to an end in 2017 at the age of 25 . she was asked if she could temporarily help as she returned to the tour . but months turned into years, and she was hailed as a professional tennis player .

title: Meet the 2025 Boxing Hall of Fame class: Pacquiao, Paz, more
content: Manny Pacquiao is inducted to the international boxing Hall of Fame on sunday . the 46-year-old will reappear in a boxing ring after nearly four years out . he will take on Mario Barrios for the welterweight title on July 19 .

title: The 20 rookies you should draft in fantasy football
content: the focus is on redraft formats in 10-team PPR leagues . the top 20 rookies are ranked, along with the rounds they should be targeted . it's never too early to start planning for the fantasy season . we are less than 100 days from opening night in Philly .
